document.heading: Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Amendment Act of 1991

history.narrative: Law 9-52, the “Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Amendment Act of 1991,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-214, which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on July 2, 1991, and October 1, 1991, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 23, 1991, it was assigned Act No. 9-94 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.

meta.search-text: ENROLLMENT(S) kwiktag ® 103 246 570 COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOTICE D.C. LAW 9-52 "Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Amendment Act of 1991 Pursuant to Section 412 of the District of Columbia Self- Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, P. L. 93-198 the Act the Council of the District of Columbia adopted Bill No. 9-214 on first and second readings, July 2, 1991, and October 1, 1991, respectively. Following the signature of the Mayor on October 23, 1991, this legislation was assigned Act No. 9-94, published in the November i, 1991, edition of the D.C. Register Vol. 38 page 6585) and transmitted to Congress on October 29, 1991 for a 30-day review, in accordance with Section 602(c)(i) of the Act. The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that this legislation became effective on the date that the President of the United States signed P. L. 102-205" on December I0, 1991, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 9-52, effective December 10, 1991. irman of the Council Public Law 102-205 waived the 30-day Congressional Review Period for this Law. Enrolled Orisnal AN ACT D,C. ACT 9-94 Oodifioation of Oo|umbi~ Code Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA OCTOBER 23, 1991 To amend the Uniform Law on Notarial Acts of 1990 to require a certificate of a notarial act to include an official stamp or seal of office. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Uniform Law on Notarial Acts Amendment Act of 1991 Sec. 2. The Uniform Law on Notarial Acts of 1990, effective March 6, 1991 (D.C. Law 8-205; D.C. Code §45-621 et seq is amended as follows a) Section 8(a D.C. Code §45-627(a is amended by striking N0te~ the phrase "may include the official stamp or seal of office and inserting Sec, 45~627 the phrase "shall include the official stamp or seal of office in its place b) Section 9(5 D.C. Code §45-628(5 is repealed. Note, Sec, 45 628 See. 3. This act shall apply as of March 6, 1991. Sec. 4. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Code §1-233(c)(1 and publication in either the District of Columbia Register, the District of 1 Enrolled Orisrlat Columbia Statutes-at-Large, or the District of Columbia Municipal Regulations.
